titleStmt.title: His Maiesties message to the House of Commons concerning an order made by them, for the borrowing of one hundred thousand pounds of the adventurers money for Ireland. Together with the ansvver of the Commons assembled in Parliament thereunto. Ordered by the Commons in Parliament, that this message and answer, be forthwith printed and published. Hen Elynge [sic], cler. Parl. Dom. Com.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Edw. Husbands and Iohn Franck, and are to be sold at their shop in the Middle-Temple, and the next doore to the Kings-Head Taverne, in Fleete-streete,

notesStmt.note: Includes: 'The answer of the House of Commons to His Maiesties message of the 13. of Aug. 1642'.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.

place.placeName: doore to the Kings-Head Taverne, in Fleete-streete
